query: What does the company say about password security?

top_5_passages.excerpt:
All employees must protect customer data and never share passwords. 
Personal data must be encrypted when stored or transmitted. 
Data access is only allowed for authorized personnel. 
Employees must report any data breach immediately to IT security. 
Customer consent is required before collecting personal information.

Passwords must be at least 12 characters long and contain numbers, letters, and symbols. 
Passwords must be changed every 90 days. 
Do not reuse old passwords for new accounts. 
Two-factor authentication must be enabled for sensitive accounts. 
Never share passwords with coworkers or third parties.

All employees must use individual accounts when accessing company systems.
Shared accounts are prohibited unless approved by IT security.
Administrative privileges must only be granted to authorized personnel.
Access rights must be reviewed every 6 months by department managers.
Employees must immediately report unauthorized system access attempts.

Employees must use secure VPN connections when working remotely.  
Company laptops should never be left unattended in public places.  
Work-related files must be stored in company-approved cloud storage.  
Do not share login credentials with family or friends.  
Regularly update remote access passwords to maintain security.

Company devices are for work purposes only. 
Personal software installations are prohibited without IT approval. 
Do not connect unauthorized devices to the company network. 
Keep software and antivirus programs up to date. 
Report lost or stolen devices immediately to IT security.
